jobTitle: 3rd shift Offset Press Apprentice $20-$23/hour DOE ($1.10 Shift Differential)
description:
Job Description

JOB SUMMARY: Assist press operators through identified procedures.

Essential Job Functions

  • Drive a clamp truck, drop rolls and open.
  • Learn to hang a roll on press and splice it in.
  • Set roll to sheet size correctly.
  • Set sheet size up and sync the Cutstar/press.
  • Start the press and understand all air adjustments on the Cutstar.
  • Install ink key liner when needed.
  • Install fountain liner, put in ink canister and put ink in the ink fountain.
  • Learn to inch, crawl and idle press.
  • Wash blankets, roller, and impression cylinders.
  • Change blankets and packing on ink units and coating unit.
  • Install plates and remove plates.
  • Learn how to startup, shut down coater and clean anilox roller.
  • Learn how to load and unload skids in delivery.
  • Learn how to clean in-press camera lens.
  • Learn how to move UV lamps in press, unplug and plug in electrical and water lines to correct unit.

KNOWLEGE, SKILLS AND ABLILITIES- The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Ability to measure product utilizing the metric system.
  • Utilize utility knife to perform precise cuts.
  • Ability to differentiate color variances.
  • Perform duties with a high attention to detail.
  • Acceptable vision or corrected vision to observe detail.
  • Ability to operate a floor jack.
